snippet: On a visit to Norway, where he was officially snubbed by officials eager to placate China, the spiritual leader also softened his stance against the suicidal form of protest.
abstract: Dalai Lama calls for outside inquiry into self-immolations of more than 130 Tibetans in anti-China demonstrations over the past five years; remarks, made during visit to Norway, suggest that he has softened his stance against suicidal form of protest.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and HENRIK PRYSER LIBELL
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Henrik Pryser Libell from Oslo.

lead_paragraph: On a visit to Norway, where he was officially snubbed by officials eager to placate China, the spiritual leader also softened his stance against the suicidal form of protest.

headline.main: Dalai Lama Urges Outside Inquiry Into Spate of Self-Immolations Among Tibetans
headline.print_headline: Dalai Lama Urges Outside Inquiry Into Spate of Self-Immolations Among Tibetans
